description.bfr.reactor.logic.efficiency: 100% = full redstone signal strength (15 blocks). 1 block ~ 7%
description.bfr.reactor.logic.error_leve: 100% = full redstone signal strength (15 blocks). 1 block ~ 7%
description.bfr.reactor.logic.reactivity: Redstone impulse will decrease CR by the strength of impulse (1-15)
Redstone impulse will increase CR by the strength of impulse (1-15)
reactor.bfr.efficiency.laser_min_energy_: Avoid negative effects of Hm (1 minute)
reactor.bfr.reactor_help1: Keep EF higher than 80% by adjusting
reactor.bfr.reactor_help_heat_multiplier: HM affects stability of reaction. And depends on reactor's heat.
Bigger values of HM increases the volatility of changes in the CR. And how fast Error level changes.
There are some ideal conditions to keep HM at 0. But if you need more power, prepare your control circuits.
reactor.bfr.reactor_help3: Automate this process with Logic Adapters
reactor.bfr.reactor_helps2: CR as close as possible to TR.
reactor.bfr.logic_help2: Output signal strength represents value divided by 15
reactor.bfr.logic_help3: CR adjustments uses input signal strength value
